item.title: Practical Objects: A Beginning Approach to Object Oriented Design
item.description: The Goal of Practical Objects I love programming, but programming is hard and existing paradigms that inflexibly insist upon perfection do not make it easier. This is not to say that paradigms and patterns produce bad code, but certain statements from peers, thought leaders, and friends permeate the space in my head when attempting to solve problems. “This approach is better because it runs faster” “This code violates SOLID” “We should roll our own library instead of using this framework” I took these statements to heart.
